benchmark_details.name: SAGE-Eval (SAfety-fact systematic GEneralization evaluation)
benchmark_details.overview: SAGE-Eval is the first benchmark designed to assess whether LLMs correctly apply well-established safety facts to naive user queries. It targets implicit safety risks and aims to evaluate LLMs' generalization abilities regarding safety.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the generalization capability of LLMs regarding safety facts and improve their reliability in addressing safety risks.

data.source: Human-validated prompts formed from safety facts sourced from reputable organizations like the CDC and FDA.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the proportion of safety facts that models responded to correctly under varying conditions.
methodology.interpretation: A higher safety score indicates better performance in addressing safety concerns in naive queries.
methodology.validation: Validated by human annotators with an average reliability rate.

harm: Potential risk of safety oversights causing harm to vulnerable populations such as children.
